page.title: 03The Village of Blackwell A
page.content: A small village on the fringe of Derbyshire, Blackwell is a close knit community which owes much of its growth and character to its mining industry - Blackwell pit. The colliery has since closed but the village retains many of the features of a pit village. The original pit houses lie in the bottom of the village whilst looking down from{The { Mount}were built the pit managers houses. Despite the closure of the pit many of the older families still live here but on the modern council estate, whilst newcomers occupy the private properties on{The Mount.}
